item.title: Alexei Navalny: Hundreds detained in protests across Russia
item.description: The jailed opposition leader's wife says she is among those held at a protest in the capital Moscow.

item.title: Coronavirus: EU vaccine woes mount as new delays emerge
item.description: AstraZeneca is the latest company, after Pfizer, to warn of delivery issues, frustrating officials.

item.title: Larry King: Veteran US broadcaster dies aged 87
item.description: The talk show host interviewed famous politicians, celebrities and sports stars in a six-decade career.

item.title: New UK coronavirus variant 'may be more deadly'
item.description: Evidence suggests the variant that emerged in the UK may be more deadly as well as faster-spreading.

item.title: What next for Trump - and Trumpism?
item.description: Stripped of presidential powers and silenced online, can Trump still make a political comeback?

item.title: National Guard: President Biden apologises over troops sleeping in car park
item.description: Photographs of National Guard members sheltering underground spark anger among lawmakers.

item.title: Trump impeachment: Senate trial delayed until next month
item.description: Arguments will not begin until the week of 8 February, giving the ex-president's lawyers time to prepare.

item.title: New light shed on Charles Darwin's 'abominable mystery'
item.description: Historical documents are uncovered that provide clues to a puzzle that haunted Charles Darwin.

item.title: Wuhan marks its anniversary with triumph and denial
item.description: In the city where the virus first emerged there is now an insistence that it came from elsewhere.

item.title: Hotel quarantine for UK arrivals to be discussed
item.description: Boris Johnson has not ruled out further action to secure the borders amid concerns over Covid variants.

item.title: Afghan war: Biden administration to review Trump's Taliban deal
item.description: Officials say they want to check the group are "living up to its commitments" as violence continues.

item.title: Covid: Gap between Pfizer vaccine doses should be halved, say doctors
item.description: Delaying second Pfizer doses to give more people their first is "difficult to justify", says BMA.

item.title: Trudeau conveys Keystone pipeline 'disappointment' to Biden
item.description: Despite the revoking of the Keystone XL permit, the Canadian PM hails "a new era" in bilateral ties.

item.title: From Sea Shanty TikTok to a record deal
item.description: Scottish postie Nathan Evans has quit his job and signed to a record label after storming TikTok with sea shanties.

item.title: Essex lorry deaths: Men jailed for killing 39 migrants in trailer
item.description: Thirty-nine Vietnamese migrants suffocated in a sealed container en route to Essex in October 2019.

item.title: How Joe Biden's ancestral Irish home is celebrating
item.description: Celebrations broke out across Ballina when Biden's presidential victory was declared - and for the young people of the town, it meant that anything was possible.

item.title: Week in pictures: 16-22 January 2021
item.description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Iran's supreme leader makes online threats to attack golfing Trump
item.description: A photomontage seems to show the ex-president playing in the shadow of a warplane or large drone.

item.title: President Biden and unity: Can the next generation unify America?
item.description: Democrat Ala'a and Republican Caleb, both 16, on whether President Biden's call for unity can be achieved.

item.title: Manaus: Brazil's city on the Amazon river buckles under second Covid wave
item.description: Doctors in the rainforest’s biggest city Manaus are struggling to control rising numbers of deaths from Covid-19 and soaring cases.

item.title: Shoppers stuck at home shun new clothes in 2020
item.description: Clothing was the hardest-hit sector last year, seeing a 25% drop in sales overall.

item.title: St Agnes Cold War bunker for sale
item.description: A bunker built during the Cold War is being auctioned with a guide price of £25,000.

item.title: The vehicle that got a village smiling
item.description: When her friends died in childbirth, a Nigerian woman hatched a plan to make a difference.

item.title: Biden wore no mask 'as he was celebrating'
item.description: The White House spokeswoman is asked why President Biden wore no mask at an inauguration engagement.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 15 - 21 January 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: Bridgerton writer's joy at second series
item.description: The author behind the book speaks exclusively to the BBC about the news of a second series.

item.title: Inside Biden's new-look Oval Office
item.description: Busts of influential civil rights leaders sit alongside portraits of famous presidents.

item.title: Biden inauguration: Amanda Gorman's poem The Hill We Climb in full
item.description: Amanda Gorman's powerful reading of her poem was one of the memorable moments at Joe Biden's inauguration.

item.title: Uganda's Yoweri Museveni overcomes Bobi Wine challenge - for now
item.description: President Yoweri Museveni sees off another challenger despite the expectation surrounding Bobi Wine.

item.title: Covid hand-outs: How different countries pay if you are sick
item.description: As the UK rejects £500 Covid pay outs, how are others countries getting people to stick to the rules?

item.title: Rémy Julienne: Stunt king to the stars who fell to Covid
item.description: Rémy Julienne was one of the world's top stunt artists, devising crashes and collisions in 1,400 films.

item.title: Islamic State tries to shore up relevance with Iraq carnage
item.description: Despite their territorial defeat, the extremists are striving to prove they still matter.

item.title: How to avoid lockdown back and shoulder pain
item.description: In lockdown, days on end can be spent hunched over a laptop without ever leaving the house.

item.title: Could Google really leave Australia?
item.description: After threatening to cut off Australia, could Google survive without it?

item.title: Covid cases, deaths and vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Why Sigourney Weaver had to say yes to Call My Agent
item.description: The Hollywood star explains why a role in the hit French comedy series was too good to refuse.

item.title: Covaxin and Covishield: What we know about India's Covid vaccines
item.description: As India starts exporting Covid vaccines, here's what we know about Covishield and Covaxin.

item.title: Wuhan lockdown: A year of China's fight against the Covid pandemic
item.description: The world's first coronavirus quarantine began in Wuhan a year ago - how has China changed since then?

item.title: 'The phone call that brought me freedom - but broke my mother's heart'
item.description: When Farah Sayeed told her mother she wasn't coming home after university, it caused a painful rift.

item.title: How Covid turbocharged the QR revolution
item.description: As a cheap and reliable way to store information, the humble QR code is finding new uses.

item.title: Africa's long wait for the Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: Africa will have to wait "weeks if not months" before getting WHO-approved vaccines, officials say.

item.title: Covid: Israel vaccine fears 'out of context and inaccurate'
item.description: Israel is likely to be the first country to see an impact from vaccination - but it is still too early.

item.title: Root keeps England in touch with Sri Lanka in finely-poised second Test
item.description: James Anderson and Joe Root keep England in contention on day two of the second Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

item.title: Paris St-Germain 4-0 Montpellier: Kylian Mbappe scores twice in win
item.description: Paris St-Germain move three points clear in Ligue 1 and boost their goal difference with a thrashing of 10-man Montpellier

item.title: Ainslie's Ineos Team UK continue Challenger Series domination to move closer to America's Cup
item.description: Sir Ben Ainslie's Ineos Team UK are into the final of the Challenger Series - which will determine who faces Team New Zealand for the America's Cup.

item.title: Benitez leaves Chinese side Dalian after 18 months in charge
item.description: Rafael Benitez leaves his role as manager of Dalian Professional after 18 months in charge of the Chinese Super League side.

item.title: Australian Open 2021: Andy Murray's hopes of playing in tournament over
item.description: Andy Murray will miss the Australian Open after failing to find a "workable quarantine" solution following his positive test for coronavirus.

item.title: Willian Jose: Wolves sign Real Sociedad striker on loan
item.description: Wolves sign Real Sociedad striker Willian Jose on loan until the end of the season and have the option to buy in the summer.

item.title: The cartoonists making mental health their muse
item.description: Meet the artists shaping graphic medicine - a genre of comics focused on the experience of living with mental illness.

item.title: Greece #Metoo: Women ending silence of sport abuse shake Greece
item.description: The decision by ex-champion Sofia Bekatorou to describe how she was assaulted leads to a #Metoo moment.

item.title: The Hong Kong migrants fleeing to start new lives in the UK
item.description: A new visa will give 5.4m Hong Kong residents the right to resettle in Britain. How many will leave?

item.title: Yellow: K-pop artist Lim Kim bites back against stereotypes
item.description: Lim Kim says her music challenges prejudices about Asian women and attacks Orientalism.

item.title: US in Somalia: 'We still need the Americans for security'
item.description: A partial withdrawal of US troops from Somalia is coming at a critical time for the country.
